ClinicalDocument.title: Department of Veterans Affairs Summarization of Episode Note

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all allergies for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities, but it does not contain allergies that were deleted or entered in error.

td.content: Propensity to adverse reactions to substance
Propensity to adverse reactions to food

code.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to substance
Propensity to adverse reactions to food

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all problems for the patient (active and inactive), from all VA treatment facilities, but it does not contain problems that were deleted.

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all medications (outpatient and self-reported) for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities, where the dispense date was within the last 15 months. It only contains medications that have an active Prescription status.

td.content: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH TWO TIMES A WEEK
TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH AT BEDTIME
TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH TWO TIMES A WEEK

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all vital signs (inpatient and outpatient) for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities, where the panel Date Taken is within 12 months up to a maximum of the 10 most recent panels. If more than one panel was taken on the same date, only the most recent panel is populated for that date.

text.content: Vital Sign Observation Text Not Available

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Medical Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all immunizations for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities.

td.content: NO CONTRAINDICATION; OK TO USE IN FUTURE.
first immunization NO CONTRAINDICATION; OK TO USE IN FUTURE.

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Encounter Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all historical (completed) Outpatient Encounters for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities where the Encounter Date was within the last 36 months, up to a maximum of the most recent 25 encounters. Ancillary visits are not included. Lists of associated note titles for each encounter are limited to a maximum of 10.

td.content: EMPLOYEE HEALTH with associated notes CARDIOLOGY PROGRESS NOTE
INFLUENZA WITH OTHER RESPIRATORY MANIFESTATIONS ICD9 487.1 with Provider Comments Influenza (ICD-9-CM 487.1)
PRIMARY CARE/MEDICINE with associated notes NUTRITION PROCEDURE NOTE,OPHTHALMOLOGY PROCEDURE NOTE,DENTISTRY DIAGNOSTIC STUDY NOTE
ACUTE UPPER RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS OF UNSPECIFIED SITE ICD9 465.9 with Provider Comments Cold
MUSCLE WEAKNESS (GENERALIZED) ICD9 728.87 with Provider Comments Weakness of limb (SNOMED CT 309774006)
VERTIGO OF CENTRAL ORIGIN ICD9 386.2 with Provider Comments Central Vertigo

text.content: IHE Encounter Template Text not used by VA

tr.th: Business Rules for Construction of Procedure Information

tr.td: This VA Document contains all historical, surgical and radiological Procedures for the patient, from all VA treatment facilities, where the Procedure Date was within the last 12 months, up to maximum of the most recent 25 procedures.
